Process Description.Description: The Accounts Payable (AP) process involves receiving, verifying, approving, and paying supplier invoices. This process ensures that payments are made accurately and on time while maintaining good relationships with suppliers and optimizing cash flow management.

Process Steps.Description: Invoices are received from suppliers either via email or physical mail.
Sub-Steps: Log the received invoice in the invoice tracking system.
Digitize physical invoices using a scanner.

Process Steps.Description: Invoices are matched against purchase orders (PO) and receiving reports to ensure accuracy.
Sub-Steps: Verify that the invoice details match the corresponding PO and receiving report.
Check for discrepancies and resolve any issues with the supplier or internal departments.

Process Steps.Description: Invoices are routed for approval based on the organization’s approval matrix.
Sub-Steps: Route the invoice to the appropriate approver(s) based on the invoice amount and department.
Approvers review and approve or reject the invoice.
Return rejected invoices to the originator for correction.

Process Steps.Description: Approved invoices are entered into the financial system for payment processing.
Sub-Steps: Enter invoice details into the accounts payable system.
Schedule payments according to payment terms.
Process payments via electronic funds transfer (EFT), check, or other methods.

Process Steps.Description: Maintain records of processed invoices and payments for auditing and reference.
Sub-Steps: Store digital copies of invoices and payment records in a secure system.
Ensure compliance with record retention policies.

Process Cycle Time.Definition: The total time taken from the receipt of an invoice to the completion of the payment.

Process KPIs.Definition: Average time taken to process an invoice from receipt to payment.
Percentage of invoices with errors (e.g. mismatches, missing information).
Total cost incurred to process a single invoice.
Percentage of invoices paid on or before the due date.
